resource.chars:
In such a manner we see that the de 
velopment of animals is complected in 
two ways: 1o Through the colonial bound 
organisms and 2o through the social 
life. - In both cases the results of 
development is a <u>synthesis <\u> of the 
organism, it is very complicity, the 
compounding and concentration of all 
systems of organs.
But this <u>synthesis<\u> will be preceded 
allways by the phenomena of <u>analysis<\u>,
- if there is permitted to me so to deno 
minate the phenomena of differentia 
tion of organs and processes.
Regarding the powerful reproduc 
tion of the queen-bee or better of 
the female of the Termits we clearly 
understend that this strong engine 
of propagation can not be developed 
itself but requires for its development 
the labour of the several generations 
of the whole of the societies.
Each process tends to separate from 
others and recalls the appearance of 
the corresponding organ. At first in 
many colonial organisms these or 
gans appear similar to the separate 
individuals.
